I heard you before I saw you, your voice all syrupy sweet, pretending to be someone you’re not. My heart was pounding so loud I thought you’d hear it. I knew something was wrong—Grandmother never sounded like that. So I hid, pressed tight behind the cupboard, barely daring to breathe. I had to. If I hadn’t, I wouldn’t be standing here now.
